info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 19 at 6:22PM CDT until May 19 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM CDT FOR BOND COUNTY... At 620 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Greenville, moving northeast at 55 mph. This storm has a history of producing a radar indicated tornado debris signature. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of Bond County, including the following locations... Smithboro, Pleasant Mound, Dudleyville and Donnellson. This includes Interstate 70 in Illinois between exits 41 and 52. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
